content.description: If you've scrambled onto the squeeze ledge to climb Eve's Drop but find it baking in the sun, this is a shady alternative. Climb moderate terrain to first and second bolt, then using underclings and crimpers, find your way through the crux to the third bolt. The guidebook mentions a hold breaking off at some point, I imagine it was near the blankness north of the second bolt. Continue past positive crimpers and rails to anchor.
A good face climb just right of the Eve's Drop arete.  This climb is somewhat similar except for a couple more powerful moves down low and a couple thinner moves up high.
content.protection: 6 or 7 bolts to drop on anchors shared with Eves Drop
content.location: On Squeeze Ledge, the second bolt line from the left above the squeeze.

climbs.name: Stoke Tank FULL
climbs.fa: in Approach shoes, Robert Powell and Andrew Hancox

content.description:
Plenty of interesting placements make the first half an easily enjoyable romp. The more vertical finish ends with a climactic shift right to an obvious tree.  

  Could use a little cleaning. One noticeable shoe-box sized loose rock half-way. Some fractures here and there. The top get's your hand's dirty, but doesn't detract from this great route.
content.protection: Plenty of gear, plug away! medium stoppers, finger-sized cams, double 1's, and a 3. No anchors, but a temporary sling.
content.location: towards the end of Squeeze Ledge, Just left of lillan's Arrete and seepage. West facing, always dry.

content.description:
This route climbs the middle of the wall directly off the Squeeze ledge.  The rock is nearly flawless, the movement stellar, and the view is a beauty.   

  This route is quintessential Obed style.  A gem of a rock climb.
content.location: Scramble up to the ledge.  Climb center route through a bulge with a thin crack.

content.description: Start on slightly less than vertical rock and work up through pockets and rails to the beautiful finish.  Enjoy the view.
content.location: This route is located on the left end of the wall that share's Glenn's Route and the Crack Route.  It climbs the arete.

content.description: Fun moves down low with a high step and reach to a little pocket lead to good blocky holds the rest of the way. The anchor at the top is two normal bolts with a couple old biners left there. It would be nicer if there were some chains there. UPDATE, there are quicklinks there now.Â
content.location: This route is directly to the left of The Crack, "Crack Route" in the Dixie Cragger.  They share an anchor.

content.description: This route climbs steep pumpy rock through a left facing corner and killer roof up high.  I found this route a bit harder than the one to the left.  See for yourself.  Another awesome route.
content.location: Right route off the Squeeze ledge.  Shares finish with Squeeze cheese.

content.description: The route wanders onto both sides of the arete on big holds with long reaches.  It ends with a mantle beneath the shuts.  Stay left to avoid joining Roulette.
content.location: This route climbs the arete above the squeeze chimney/pathway that gives the ledge its name.

content.description: Fun trad climb, makes a good first trad lead. The top anchors from the sport Glenn's 10 are used for this climb as well.
content.protection: Beginning moves need a 2, having two 3 and a 4 would make this route much easier to protect. Smaller cams can easily protect the top. Can be climbed on smaller cams but the placement must be perfect.
content.location: Climb down the body width squeeze to the secluded squeeze ledge.

content.description: You will be facing this route as soon as you top out the scramble up to the squeeze ledge. I found myself climbing the crack for the majority of the climb and having to step out onto the face to make  some very awkward clips although the guidebook says the route follows the face. I wouldn't bother to climb it again as it was poorly bolted, would make a better trad climb.
content.protection: 5 bolts to anchors (2 bolts with quicklinks)
content.location: Bolted line directly in front of you after topping out the scramble up to the ledge, farthest bolted line to the right on the ledge

content.description: Relatively difficult to find wall. Hot in the afternoon, with a couple trees at the top. We've tried to clean the rocks from the upclimb but rockfall is still a concern.
